net.librec.recommender.cf.ranking

Class LDARecommender

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.librec.recommender.AbstractRecommender
      • net.librec.recommender.ProbabilisticGraphicalRecommender
        • net.librec.recommender.cf.ranking.LDARecommender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Recommender

    @ModelData(value={"isRanking","lda","userTopicProbs","topicItemProbs","trainMatrix"})
public class LDARecommender
extends ProbabilisticGraphicalRecommender
    Latent Dirichlet Allocation for implicit feedback: Tom Griffiths, Gibbs sampling in the generative model of Latent Dirichlet Allocation, 2002.

    Remarks: This implementation of LDA is for implicit feedback, where users are regarded as documents and items as words. To directly apply LDA to explicit ratings, Ian Porteous et al. (AAAI 2008, Section Bi-LDA) mentioned that, one way is to treat items as documents and ratings as words. We did not provide such an LDA implementation for explicit ratings. Instead, we provide recommender URP as an alternative LDA model for explicit ratings.

    Author:
    guoguibing and Keqiang Wang

      • predict

        protected double predict(int userIdx,
             int itemIdx)
                  throws LibrecException
        Description copied from class: AbstractRecommender
        predict a specific rating for user userIdx on item itemIdx, note that the prediction is not bounded. It is useful for building models with no need to bound predictions.

        Returns:

        Throws:
        LibrecException - if error occurs during predicting
